Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility is conducting unwarranted restraints.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was a DCWL Consultant when reviewing
incident reports on March 19, 2024, there was no additional
information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Youth A said he does not remember the restraints from
March 5, 2024, or March 6, 2024. Youth A said staff will restrain
him when he gets “really angry, really fast” and “hurts people”.
Youth A said staff never restrain him when he is calm or when he
is not hurting other people. Youth A said he does not have any
injury from any restraint and said the staff usually just let him go
because he has asthma and trouble breathing during restraints.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 4,
2024. Youth B said he was in the classroom on March 5, 2024,
when Youth A was restrained. Youth B said he and Youth A were
arguing and Youth A threw his flipflop at him, so he got up and hit
Youth A. Youth B said Staff 5 and Staff 6 got in between him and
Youth B to stop the fight. Youth B said he walked away but Youth A
was trying to push past Staff 5 to get to him and then began to
punch Staff 5. Staff 5 and Staff 6 put Youth A in a restraint. Youth
B said he did not see any concerns with the restraint and is not
aware of Youth A obtaining any injury from the restraint.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Staff 5 said he was working in the school with Youth A
on March 5, 2024. Staff 5 said Youth A had just been placed at
Clarence Fischer Center and staff were beginning to build a
2

relationship with him. Staff 5 said Youth A and Youth B began to
argue with one another during class and Youth B made a hand
gesture to Youth A, hitting him in the head. Staff 5 said Youth A
became very upset and started to grab items and throw them at
Youth B. Staff 5 said Youth B advanced at Youth A and assaulted
him. Staff 5 said he and Staff 6 were able to get in between Youth
A and Youth B however Youth A continued to attempt to get to
Youth A so he and Staff 6 placed Youth A in a restraint to prevent
him from getting to Youth B. Staff 5 said Youth A dropped his
weight so they released him. Staff 5 said Youth A then left the
classroom and talked to a supervisor. Staff 5 said Youth A was
restrained due to attempting to assault Youth B and he did not
have any concerns with the restraint.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Staff 6 said he was working in the classroom with Youth
A and Youth B on March 5, 2024. Staff 6 said Youth B began
picking on Youth A and Youth A started to argue back. Staff 6 said
he was trying to talk to Youth A about moving away from Youth B
however he refused and threw his flipflops at Youth B. Staff 6 said
Youth B went after Youth A assaulting him. Staff 6 said he and
Staff 5 attempted to separate Youth A and Youth B however Youth
A continued to attempt to get to Youth B therefore they placed
Youth A into a standing restraint. Staff 6 said Youth A dropped to
the ground and was released. Staff 6 said he talked to Youth A and
Youth A then left the unit and talked to a supervisor. Staff 6 said
Youth A had just recently been placed at Clarence Fischer Center
so the staff were just getting to know him and build a relationship
with him. Staff 6 said he did not have any concerns about
restraint.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 10, 2024. Supervisor 1 said on March 6, 2024, she was
radioed to bring Youth A his inhaler. Supervisor 1 went outside,
and Youth A was screaming, punching, and kicking Supervisor 2,
Chief Administrator, Residential Program Operations Manager.
Supervisor 1 said Youth A was offered his inhaler and refused to
use it. Supervisor 1 said Youth A was released from the restraint,
she was unable to remember exactly why, and then he walked
inside and was once again offered his inhaler however refused to
use it. Supervisor 1 said Youth A once again began to punch and
kick her and therefore was placed in a team restraint by
Supervisor 2 Residential Program Operations Manager.
Supervisor 1 said she did not see the initiation of the restraint
outside however the one inside she felt was warranted based on
Youth A’s assaultive behaviors. Supervisor 1 said she did not have
3

concerns about what she saw outside and the restraint inside with
Youth A.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on April 4, 2024. Chief Administrator said she was
walking out to her car with Residential Program Operations
Manager to leave for the day when they heard yelling and saw
Youth A throwing dirt and rocks at Staff 7. Chief Administrator said
she walked over to the area and told Staff 7 to go inside thinking
Staff 7 may have been the target and reason Youth A was acting
out. Chief Administrator said Supervisor 2 came outside and she,
Residential Program Operations Manager, and Supervisor 2 were
trying to talk to Youth A however he continued to be upset and was
throwing rocks at them, hitting Residential Program Operations
Manager in the ear and Supervisor 2 in the head. Chief
Administrator said they attempted to give Youth A some space and
verbally deescalate however he stood up and began to punch and
kick her, so he was placed in a standing restraint by her and
Residential Program Operations Manager. Chief Administrator
said Youth A began to breath very heavily, so she called
Supervisor 1 to bring his inhaler and they released the restraint.
Chief Administrator said Youth A refused his inhaler however his
breathing continued to be labored so they called 911 for
assistance. Chief Administrator said Youth A agreed to go inside
however once inside Youth A began to push, punch, and kick
Supervisor 1 and was placed in another team restraint by
Supervisor 2 and Residential Program Operations Manager. Chief
Administrator said Youth A was once again offered his inhaler
however refused. Chief Administrator said the police and EMS
arrived and Youth A was screaming for the police to give him a
gun so he could shoot himself. Chief Administrator said the EMS
was able to calm him down and transport him to the hospital for an
evaluation. Chief Administrator said her legs were bruised from
being repeatedly kicked, and Residential Program Operations
Manager’s ear was swollen the following day from Youth A.
Residential Program Operations Manager was interviewed
face-to-face at the facility on March 27, 2024. Residential
Program Operations Manager said she was walking out of the
building for the day with Chief Administrator and heard screaming
and yelling. They went around the building and saw Youth A with a
stick threatening to hit Staff 7. Residential Program Operations
Manager said she and Chief Administrator went over to Youth A
and removed the stick and told Staff 7 to go inside as they thought
Youth A was targeting and upset with Staff 7. Residential Program
Operations Manager said Youth A did not calm down but rather
4

continued to escalate, making suicidal comments and went after
her and Chief Administrator hitting, kicking, and spitting at them.
Residential Program Operations Manager said Youth A was
placed in a team control restraint and then dropped his weight so
was released. Residential Program Operations Manager said
Youth A began to throw rocks and dirt at staff and they just backed
up and tried to move out of the way of things being thrown at
them. Residential Program Operations Manager said Youth A was
breathing hard and Supervisor 1 came outside with his inhaler
however he refused to use it. Residential Program Operations
Manager said police and EMS were called due to Youth A
behaviors and heavy breathing and upon their arrival he calmed
down and was transported to the hospital for an evaluation.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 4, 2024. Supervisor 2 said he was called out to assist with
Youth A on March 6, 2024. Supervisor 2 said when he got outside
Youth A was on the ground yelling, screaming, and very escalated.
Supervisor 2 said Chief Administrator was asking him if he needed
his inhaler and Youth A said no and began to throw rocks and dirt
at staff. Supervisor 2 said Youth A was given some space as he,
Chief Administrator, and Residential Program Operations Manager
were trying to verbally deescalate. Supervisor 2 said Youth A got
up and charged either Chief Administrator or Residential Program
Operations Manager, he was unable to remember, hitting and
kicking them and therefore was placed in a restraint. Supervisor 2
said he felt the restraint was warranted and was appropriate.
Supervisor 2 had no concerns regarding the restraint.
Video Review:
Video footage of March 5, 2024, classroom was viewed on
April 12, 2024. The video footage shows Youth B running over to
Youth A and hitting him. Staff 5 and Staff 6 are seen getting in
between Youth A and Youth B. Youth A is pushing and trying to get
past Staff 5 and Staff 6 and ultimately punches Staff 5 in the face
and is placed in a standing team control and then escorted out of
the classroom.
Video footage of March 6, 2024, hallway by the entrance door
was viewed on April 15, 2024. The video footage shows Youth A
walking inside with Supervisor 1, Chief Administrator, Residential
Program Operations Manager, Supervisor 2, Supervisor 3, and
Case Manager. Youth A is stopped by the hallway as staff stand
around him. Youth A stands against the wall, then hits the wall.
Youth A walks to the hallway and Supervisor 1, Residential
Program Operations Manager, and Supervisor 2 stand in front of
5

him, not allowing him to pass by them. Youth A pushes Supervisor
1, then backs up for a moment before walking towards Supervisor
1, Residential Program Operations Manager, and Supervisor 2.
Supervisor 2 takes Youth A by the right arm and Residential
Program Operations Manager then takes Youth A’s left arm and
they place him in a team restraint which only lasts about three
seconds and Supervisor 2 appears to push Youth A down to the
ground. Youth A gets back up right away, and Supervisor 1 stands
directly in front of Youth A, Supervisor 2 stands directly to Youth
A’s left, Residential Program Operations Manager is to Youth A’s
right, and his back is against the wall. The staff block Youth A from
going anywhere with their bodies. Youth A then kicks Supervisor 1
in the leg and Residential Program Operations Manager and
Supervisor 2 immediately place Youth A in a team restraint with
Supervisor 2 on the left side of Youth A’s body and Residential
Program Operations Manager on the right side for one minute and
twelve seconds. Once Youth A is released, he is under the camera
and unable to be viewed, Supervisor 1, Chief Administrator,
Residential Program Operations Manager, Supervisor 2,
Supervisor 3, and Case Manager continue to stand in the
entryway with Youth A. Supervisor 1 is seen with Youth A’s inhaler
in her hands. Black socks are seen being thrown from the
direction that Youth A is under the camera toward Residential
Program Operations Manager. Supervisor 3 is seen opening the
door as the camera footage ends.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s MiSACWIS Incident Reports:
o Incident Report 176610218 dated March 5, 2024,
12:27 PM. The majority of the incident report was
consistent with Staff 5 and Staff 6’s interviews. The
incident report was not clear that Youth B had
assaulted Youth A and staff stood in between the
youth and Youth A continued to attempt to push past
staff and pursue Youth B, eventually punching Staff 5
in the face which was the reason for the restraint.
o Incident Report 176620219 dated March 6, 2024, at
5:25pm. The report said while in the gym Youth A
began to be physically aggressive towards peers
and staff. The report said staff attempted to place
him in a restraint however Youth A dropped his
weight and was released.
o Incident Report 176590219 dated March 6, 2024, at
5:35pm. The incident report outlines the incident in
the gym, when Youth A became upset with his peers.
The report says Youth A was verbally aggressive,
6

threw his flip-flops at peers and staff, and walked
outside the gym. The report said Youth A then took a
tree branch and was swinging at staff which lead to a
team restraint for a short time and the staff released
due to Youth A dropping his weight. The report said
Youth A continued to make threats, find objects to
throw, and began to walk to the unit with staff
following.
o Incident Report 176630218 dated March 6, 2024, at
6:00pm. The incident report is consistent with staff
interviews regarding Youth A being outside and then
walking inside the building.
• Supervisor 1’s personnel file was reviewed. Supervisor 1
There was no disciplinary record and Supervisor 1
completed restraint training on April 7, 2023.
• Supervisor 2’s personnel file was reviewed. There was no
disciplinary record and Supervisor 2 completed restraint
training on January 17, 2024.
• Residential Program Operations Manager’s personnel file
was reviewed. Residential Program Operations Manager’s
had a warning dated March 3, 2017, for medication error,
and a one-day suspension dated February 7, 2018, for
insubordination.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance with Youth Restraint. After
review of video footage, Youth A was placed in two unwarranted
restraints by Residential Program Operations Manager and
Supervisor 2. Youth A was attempting to move past staff however
his behavior did not rise to the level of a serious threat of violence
or injury.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered to the facility to review how
many staff respond in crisis situations. In this incident there were
seven staff in Youth A’s close vicinity which may escalate the
youth’s emotions and behaviors. Additionally, the facility should
review the use of “close proximity” as staff being so close to a
youth may provoke an emotional response.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
7

or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility did not complete an incident report for a restraint.
Investigation Video Review:
Video footage of March 6, 2024, hallway by the entrance door
was viewed on April 15, 2024. The video footage shows Youth A
was placed in two restraints. The first restraint was when Youth A
walks to the hallway and Supervisor 1, Residential Program
Operations Manager, and Supervisor 2 stand in front of him, not
allowing him to pass by them. Youth A pushes Supervisor 1, then
backs up for a moment before walking towards Supervisor 1,
Residential Program Operations Manager, and Supervisor 2.
Supervisor 2 takes Youth A by the right arm and Residential
Program Operations Manager then takes Youth A’s left arm and
they place him in a team restraint which only lasts about three
seconds and Supervisor 2 appears to push Youth A down to the
ground.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s MiSACWIS Incident Reports. There was no
incident report for Youth A’s restraint with Supervisor 2 and
Residential Program Operations Manager that lasted
approximately three second before they released due to
Youth A dropping his weight.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as video footage shows
Youth A was placed in two restraints in the hallway by the
entrance door, but an incident report was not completed for the
first restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
